page.title: 03Animals of Eglwysbach
page.content: In Eglwysbach there are a lot of wild animals. The most common being rabbits but there are not as many as there were long ago, when people used to hunt them. In winter the rabbits go deeper into the ground. There are more rabbits than hares. On the farms there are quite a lot of animals. Because the farms now have silage and cake, there are more animals than there used to be. Only a few farms keep pigs but long ago many villagers kept a pig in the garden. I think that the most common animal on the farm is the cow. Most of the children in Eglwysbach have a cat or a dog. I do not think that anybody has a budgie here. Nobody has a turtle or a guinea-pig either. Long ago nearly everybody had a pet of their own.
